author: Special Correspondent
text:
Puducherry Municipality has launched a fortnight-long special thematic drive to reinforce and consolidate the strides made under the Swachh Bharat Mission in maintaining cleanliness of government offices and buildings.

R. Chandirasekaran, Municipal Commissioner said that cleanliness activities would be carried out at government establishments during the drive that began earlier this week and will continue till March 15.

Rating based on parameters

Based on the tidiness of the Government buildings, ratings would be given to it on the basis of parameters set by the Ministry of Urban Development during the period between March 16 and 21. The results of the assessment would be published on March 22.

The points accrued in this drive would be aggregated by the assessors of the Quality Council of India while conducting the Swachh Survekhan survey wherein sanitation and hygiene of urban regions in India would be reviewed and cities ranked on their basis.

The Commissioner has urged heads of government establishments to take necessary measures to spruce up their premises.

Ratings would be given on the basis of parameters set by the Ministry of Urban Development
title: A thematic drive to reinforce cleanliness in govt. offices
